content: this is dmg and we're going to be crafting Oh
okay so we're getting to the wonderful world of books unfortunately not DVDs in
the fantasy world and so we're going to grab the same lollipop sticks we used
before for the shelves so you may even have some left over and I'm just going
to measure the same diameter which for mine was one centimeter and on some
cardstock I was going to rule across and cut it out and this is going to form the
covers of the books so I'm just going to make sure that it's a clean cutting make
sure the edges are straight and we're going to be using the the uncoloured
side as the exterior of the book and the colored side as the interior so grab
some of the lollipop sticks and we're going to measure out seven millimeters
so you want to want make it a little bit less than what the actual width of that
so they become rectangles and not squares because most books as you know
are rectangles so I'm just going to measure those lines then you're grab
some scissors and start cutting out those rectangles and so these are going
to form the pages of looks it's not a super secret formula but it works very
well so now I'll just grab a bit of quite a low weight paper so this is just
out of a local Lum magazine that is for you know coupons and things like that so
I'll just cut out a 1 centimeter strip as well and I'm going to clean up the
edge of the cardboard so now we're going to use the edge that has all the
printing and everything on it and that's going to be the inside so I'm going to
add a little bit of hot glue and then put on a piece of the board and you see
I've left a little bit hanging off the edge and then we're going to fold it
over so that the lollipop stick basically gets sandwiched inside so I've
only glued the one side here at the moment but I wanted to get good fold and
then we just cut it off so now we have that bit of cardboard of a lollipop
stick inside then I apply glue to the other side of the lollipop stick and
stick there and there we have a closed book
just hold it down until it's hardened so nice and easy closed book obviously it
gets a little bit more difficult when you want to do open books so the how you
do that is the same process grab the cardboard stick on a piece of lollipop
stick leaving a little piece of the or the cardboard sticking over then I don't
glue on the second piece I just put that in there so I can fold the cardboard to
get the right dimensions in the fold so fold that nicely and alap of the edge so
now we still go to that loose piece and then we apply the hot glue and stick in
the second piece so stick that in and now we have an open book but it's a
little bit boring because we don't actually have any pages other than the
stack of pages that looks like a big thick phonebook so what I'm going to do
is just apply some glue in the middle this is going to be a slightly open book
and it's not a fully open book so I'm just going to hold it at basically 45
degrees open and let the glue harden and there you go I have a slightly open book
so now we're going to make a completely open book so it's again same process
apply the first one put the second one on fold the cardboard over and make sure
that the fold is quite good and then we're going to lop off the excess
cardboard and stick down the second lollipop stick and this is where it gets
more interesting so we're going to have to grab some white glue so the craft
glue white glue PVA glue and everything that we talked about in episode one and
that's what we're now going to apply down the Middle's that are going to put
this paper in so I'm just going to make sure that this paper is straight cut off
the dodgy edge and apply the white glue in the spine area there where there's a
quite a separation and onto the one side of the lollipop stick then ice put in
the paper and stick it down a little bit and go up off the excess I'm going to
just use a match to just push that into the center spine
area then repeat the process on the other side again applying glue in the
spine area okay and then I'll dip it onto the popsicle stick again and then
applying the paper once more so this gives a flat open-book look and it's a
you know gives that sort of sense of actual paper there even though the
underneath is not so what I've done here is I've curled the paper first so I
rolled it over my hand and I killed it now I place another bit of white glue in
the middle and I then stick in the curls of the curl is back against the page and
we just put a little bit of white glue underneath that page so that will stick
in place so just a DAB and that will hold in place you'd be quite delicate
here because otherwise it will fall out on you and we're going to do the same
thing on the side so roll the paper over to turn like a scroll and that will make
it curly and then we just lop off the curl and again applying the white glue
in the center and placing the page in so that you then have the curved page and a
bit of a white glue again just to stick the page down so there you have an open
book nice and easy I don't do terribly many of those I do
mainly close books but every now and again a nice open book is good so here's
just another example slightly different curve to the pages so I'm just going to
boot the speed here to show you sort of you can create quite a factory of

now if the paint's coming to the end you can lash it around like you just saw

books wouldn't be white pages they're more likely to be yellowy white so
that's why I've mixed those colors in and just paint all around the pages try
not to paint onto the cover and just on the pages themselves so that would be
